briefdescription.para: 3D structure storing node IDs of presynaptic neurons.
Whether the 3D structure has been deleted.
Needed during readout of sources_.
Needed during readout of sources_.

If we detect an overflow in one of the MPI buffer parts, we save our current position in sources_ to continue at that point in the next communication round, while filling up (possible) remaining parts of the MPI buffer.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::vector< std::map< index, SpikeData > > > nest::SourceTable::compressible_sources_
memberdef.name: compressible_sources_

briefdescription.para: A structure to temporarily hold information about all process local targets will be addressed by incoming spikes.

detaileddescription.para: Data from this structure is transferred to the compressed_spike_data_ structure of ConnectionManager during construction of the postsynaptic connection infrastructure. Arranged as a two dimensional vector (thread|synapse) with an inner map (source node id -> spike data).

briefdescription.para: A structure to temporarily store locations of "unpacked spikes" in the compressed_spike_data_ structure of ConnectionManager.

detaileddescription.para: Data from this structure is transferred to the presynaptic side during construction of the presynaptic connection infrastructure. Arranged as a two dimensional vector (thread|synapse) with an inner map (source node id -> index).

briefdescription.para: Minimal number of sources that need to be deleted per synapse type and thread before a reallocation of the respective vector is performed.

detaileddescription.para: Balances number of reallocations and memory usage.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread rank_start, const thread rank_end, const Source &source) const
memberdef.name: source_should_be_processed_

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this Source object should be considered when constructing MPI buffers for communicating connections.

detaileddescription.para: Returns false if i) this entry was already processed, or ii) this entry is disabled (e.g., by structural plastcity) or iii) the reading thread is not responsible for the particular part of the MPI buffer where this entry would be written.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the following entry in the SourceTable has the same source gid.
Returns true if the previous entry in the SourceTable has the same source gid.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SourceTablePosition &current_position, const Source &current_source, const thread source_rank, TargetData &next_target_data) const
memberdef.name: populate_target_data_fields_

briefdescription.para: Fills the fields of a TargetData during construction of * presynaptic connection infrastructure.

Delete data structures.

memberdef.name: add_source

briefdescription.para: Adds a source to sources_.
Clears sources_.
Returns true if sources_ has been cleared.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread tid, const thread rank_start, const thread rank_end, thread &source_rank, TargetData &next_target_data)
memberdef.name: get_next_target_data

briefdescription.para: Returns the next target data, according to the current_positions_.
Rejects the last target data, and resets the current_positions_ accordingly.
Stores current_positions_ in saved_positions_.
Restores current_positions_ from saved_positions_.
Resets saved_positions_ to end of sources_.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread tid, const synindex syn_id, const index lcid) const
memberdef.name: get_node_id

briefdescription.para: Returns the node ID of the source at tid|syn_id|lcid.
Returns a reference to all sources local on thread; necessary for sorting.
Determines maximal saved_positions_ after which it is safe to delete sources during clean().
Resets all processed flags.

detaileddescription.para: Needed for restructuring connection tables, e.g., during structural plasticity update.

briefdescription.para: Removes all entries marked as processed.
Sets current_positions_ for this thread to minimal values so that these are not considered in find_maximal_position().
Computes MPI buffer positions for unique combination of source node ID and synapse type across all threads for all secondary connections.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread tid, const synindex syn_id, const index snode_id) const

briefdescription.para: Finds the first entry in sources_ at the given thread id and synapse type that is equal to snode_id.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread tid, const synindex syn_id, const index lcid)

briefdescription.para: Marks entry in sources_ at given position as disabled.
Removes all entries from sources_ that are marked as disabled.

briefdescription.para: Returns node IDs for entries in sources_ for the given thread id, synapse type and local connections ids.

memberdef.argsstring: (const thread tid, const synindex syn_id) const
memberdef.name: num_unique_sources

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of unique node IDs for given thread id and synapse type in sources_.

detaileddescription.para: This number corresponds to the number of targets that need to be communicated during construction of the presynaptic connection infrastructure.

briefdescription.para: Resizes sources_ according to total number of threads and synapse types.

memberdef.argsstring: (const index source_node_id, const synindex syn_id) const
memberdef.name: pack_source_node_id_and_syn_id

briefdescription.para: Encodes combination of node ID and synapse types as single long number.
This data structure stores the node IDs of presynaptic neurons during postsynaptic connection creation, before the connection information has been transferred to the presynaptic side.

detaileddescription.para: The core structure is the three dimensional sources vector, which is arranged as follows: 1st dimension: threads 2nd dimension: synapse types 3rd dimension: node IDs After all connections have been created, the information stored in this structure is transferred to the presynaptic side and the sources vector can be cleared.
